sourceDesc.p: This is a born-digital edition created through custom XSLT from a OmniOutliner 3 XML file on 26 February 2014.

tei:row.tei:cell: "Maṭbaʿalar Ḥakkında Niẓāmname / Maṭbaʿa Niẓāmnāmesidir." Promulgated on 20 Jum I 1273 aH [16 Jan. 1857]. In Düstur 2 of Tertip I. Dersaadet: Matbaa-i Amire, 1872: 227-228
maṭbaʿa niẓāmnāmesidir, Law on Printing Presses

"Règlement de la Censure de la Presse." Promulgated on 2 Shaʿ 1281 aH [31 Dec. 1864]. In Législation Ottomane, Ou Recueil des Lois, Règlements, Ordonnances, Traités, Capitulations et Autres Documents Officiels de L'empire Ottoman 3 Edited by Dēmētrios Nikolaides. Translated by Grégorios Aristarchi Bey. Constantinople: Bureau du Journal Thraky, 1874: 320-325
"Maṭbūʿāt Niẓāmnāmesi Dheyli." Promulgated on 10 Shaʿ 1292 aH, 29 Agh 1291 R [10 Sep. 1875]. In Düstur 3 of Tertip I. Dersaadet: Matbaa-i Amire, 1872: 443
maṭbūʿāt niẓāmnāmesi zeyli, Supplement to the law on printed material
official permit to publish the weekly (Wednesday) "dimashq" in Damascus for Aḥmad ʿIzzat Bey and Aḥmad ʿArafī Bey
No reasons given. Lisān's gap in publication between no. 52 (15 Apr) and 53 (13 May)
BOA MF Mkt 58/80, 1 Dhu II 1295 aH [26 Nov. 1878]
Adīb Naẓmī and Ṭāhir Maghribī Efendi obtained the permit to publish a weekly political and literary paper in Damascus and to open a printing press for this purpose
Incitement to tax evasion and a false report
BOA MF Mkt 63/90, 21 Raj 1296 aH [11 Jul. 1879]
Amīn Efendi Tarakci obtained the permit to publish a weekly, Ottoman and Arabic speaking newspaper under the title of al-Shām in Damascus
permit to resume its publication in Arabic and Ottoman after being shut down for some months
No reasons given. Lisān's gap of publication of 3 numbers at some point between 23 Dec and 13 Jan
MoI sent instructions to ban all reports on the death of Sultan ʿAbdulaziz
False news about the government of Lebanon
False news about the government of Lebanon
Insult to the sultan's consort.for insulting the Sultan in its no 21 of 22 Dhu II 1298
insulting the Druze community in no 123
False news about evens in Alexandria
insulting the Druze community, repeated punishment, imperial order
false reports on the cordon sanitaire around Beirut in no 83
False and exaggerated news about Lebanon
Upsetting news. over article in no 122
For a report on the Shūf
For a report on the Shūf
Lies about Midḥat Pasha and ʿAbdul ʿAzīz
warning for Bashīr's number on the occasion of the Sultan's birthday
A controversy about Voltaire involving personal invective and incitement to public disturbances
A controversy about Voltaire involving personal invective and incitement to public disturbances
Najīb Efendi al-Bustānī received the permit to [resume] publishing. two months after the death of Salīm al-Bustānī
Najīb Efendi al-Bustānī received the permit to [resume] publishing.two months after the death of Salīm al-Bustānī
PRO FO 195/1480 Beirut 40, Eldridge to Wyndham 10 Dec. 1884
orders to destroy all newspapers from Egypt upon arrival
For publishing certain comments on the Mutaṣarrif of Lebanon
For publishing certain comments on the Mutaṣarrif of Lebanon
False reports of disturbances in Damascus. banned for false reports about riots in Damascus (19 Dhu II 1302)
False and insulting news about the Czar. banned from publication for one month for reports on the Tzar's journey in no 928 (13 Jan 1887). Actually implemented
False reports on the Anglo-Turkish talks.
Untrue reports on the Anglo-Turkish talks. prohibition to quote from foreign newspapers
prohibition to quote from foreign newspapers
opinion piece advising not to publish excerpts from foreign papers
False news inciting the people to riot
BOA DH Mkt 1494/15, 1 Raj 1305 aH [14 Mar. 1888]
The former director of education in Syria, Ṭāhir Efendi, applied to publish a newspaper in Damascus under the title of Riyāḥāt al-Afkār
Permit issued for an Arabic, Ottoman, and French speaking newspaper in Damascus
Excitement of religious controversy. For no 515 [impossible as 515 was published in 1880], probably banned for a month as there are only 26 numbers between mid-Mar and mid-Oct
BOA DH Mkt 1500/13, 29 Raj 1305 aH [11 Apr. 1888]

Ṭāhir Efendi, former director of education, obtained the permit to publish an Ottoman, Arabic, and French-speaking newspaper in Damascus and Syria and to open a printing press under the title of Riyāḥāt al-Afkār
BOA MF Mkt 100/33, 21 Dhu I 1305 aH [30 Jul. 1888]

Notification from the ministry of the interior that will be treated, concering Adīb Naẓmī Efendi's application to open a printing press and to publish a newspaper under the title of al-Ṣabāḥ in Damascus
Offending the Sultan. gap of publication between no 968 (11 May) and 969 (8 Jun)
Failure to print the necessary titles and praises with the Sultan's name

Harming the public interest (set aside by court action, 9 Sep 1889), somewhat confirmed. For an article on 6 Ram (no. 1160). Lisān, in its first number after the ban, speaks of 2 months only (between 1168 and 1169), but does not elaborate on the reasons
Warning against TF to comply with censorship. orders issued to the post to not deliver copies to the subscribers without prior compliance
BOA DH Mkt 1660/131, 29 Muḥ 1307 aH [25 Sep. 1889]
Khālid Efendi from Kars applied for the permit to open a printing press and publish a newspaper under the title Kawākib al-Sharq in Damascus
Jessup, Henry Harris. Fifty-three Years in Syria. Vol.II. London, Edinburgh: Fleming H. Revell company, 1910:549-553Bashīr 15 Jan. 1890:2-3

For not having an Irade for publication and printing a telegram in its No. 46 that was similarly reproduced in Lisān and others without objections from the censor. After eight months the paper got the permit as a religious newspaper, henceforth prohibiting any political news
prohibition of import of the Armenian paper Sur Hintak from the USA into the OE
A disturbing article about the rights of Jews. No gap in publication dates.
BOA DH Mkt 1718/21, 25 Shaʿ 1307 aH [16 Apr. 1890]
Khālid Efendi from Kars applied for the permit to publish a bi-lingual Ottoman Arabic newspaper under the title Ruḥta al-Shām in Damascus
publication of the paper banned indefinitely
BOA DH Mkt 1727/69, 10 Shaw 1307 aH [30 May 1890]
Khālid Efendi from Kars obtained the permit to publish a bi-lingual Ottoman Arabic newspaper under the title Ruḥta al-Shām in Damascus
concession to publish a newspaper in Ottoman and Arabic under the title "rawḍat al-shām" is granted to Khālid Efendi al-Qārislī
Application with the seal of Muḥammad Asʿad Efendi, director of the Tobacco Regie in Damascus, for the publication of a newspaper in Damascus
the ministry of internal affairs issued an indefinite ban against the paper
No reason given. missing from the AUB collection, but the numbering indicates a ban of 5 months prior to March 1892
BOA DH Mkt 1888/29, 8 Rab II 1309 aH [19 Nov. 1891]
Muṣṭafā [Wāṣif] Efendi from Damascus applied to oben a printing press and to publish the newspaper al-shām in Damascus
This is the permit for the newspaper al-shām, to be published in Damascus

permit for "al-Shām". publisher is Muṣṭafā Wāṣif Efendi, director of the provincial printing press, who has many years of experience printing. The paper will publish cultural and political news thrice a week in Arabic and Ottoman
BOA DH Mkt 1913/59, 18 Jum II 1309 aH [19 Jan. 1892]
Muṣṭafā [Wāṣif] Efendi from Damascus, who had applied to oben a printing press and to publish the newspaper al-shām in Damascus, petitioned to this end
announcing the publication of a new newspaper under the title "al-shām". owner is Muṣṭafā Wāṣif, editor and director is Adīb Naẓmī
BOA DH Mkt 1961/10, 18 Dhu II 1309 aH [14 Jul. 1892]

Khālid Efendi from Kars had applied to publish a newspaper under the title of rawḍat al-shām and to open a printing press for the printing of books and pamphlets. The application was rejected and he now petitioned for a investigation of the matter.
2 months' gap in publication which is not commented on. the first issue after the gap is 891
Bashīr's lack of publication between no 1045 (5 Oct) and 1046 (9 Nov)
Violation of the censor's warning. gap of publication between no 1045 (5 Oct) and 1046 (9 Nov), or 1046 (12 Oct.) and 1047 (16 Nov)
the owner of the librairie universelle Amīn Efendi al-Khūrī obtained the concession/permit to publish "kawkab al-sharq" in Beirut
Printing something not in the draft copy
Publication of two sentences not in the draft copy
"Niẓām Al-Maṭābiʿ Al-Jadīda." Promulgated on 21 Jum II 1312 aH [20 Nov. 1894]. In Thamarāt 1013 Bayrūt: Jamʿiyyat al-Funūn, 1895: 2
Niẓām Al-Maṭābiʿ, Law on Printing Presses
For errors, perhaps because of a slip of the pen
Permit granted under the condition that the proprietor will never again violate the law
Publishing announcements not permitted by the terms of its license
Publishing announcements not permitted by the terms of its license
Publishing announcements not permitted by the terms of its license
BOA MF Mkt 440/10, 13 Dhu I 1316 aH [25 Mar. 1899]
Concerning the expressed wish of Jirjī Simān and Jirjī Mattī Efendi's to publish a newspaper under the title of al-shams in Damascus. they shall apply to the ministry of the interior in this affair
Publishing uncensored material, changing words and substituting sentences in the approved draft
Publishing deleted articles, starting forbidden controversies
BOA DH Mkt 2230/2, 29 Rab I 1317 aH [7 Aug. 1899]

Muṣṭafā [Wāṣif] Efendi, director of the provincial printing press and publisher of the Arabic-speaking newspaper al-Shām obtained the permit to publish a newspaper under the title of Ḥawādith al-Muqtabas
General warning prohibiting the publication of uncensored articles and altering words in approved articles
Permit for Ḥawādith al-Muqtabas to be published in Damascus. Publication interval not specified

"al-sham" reports that Jirjī Efendi Matti from Acre who is a teacher at the Greek Orthodox school in Damascus obtained the imperial permit to publish a scientific journal in Damascus twice a month under the tile "al-Shams"
repeated publishing of uncensored material by Miṣbāḥ or any other paper will be punished with ban
Publication of French announcements without license
Publication of material in contravention of earlier warnings
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
the third number of the al-shams magazine was published in Dam by Jūrj Matā and Jūrj Samān [!], scientific, literary, philosophical articles published. annual subscription outside Dam = Frcs 10
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law by publishing uncensored materials
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law by publishing uncensored materials
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law. Cioeta confuses the Julian for a Gregorian date
after a long absence, al-Miṣbāḥ recommenced publication.
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law.
Imperial orders for the reorganisation and centralisation of press censorship
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law. No gap in publication dates
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law. No gap in publication after no 3879 (22 Nov)
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Publication of an article which violated the principles of the Press Law
first issue after a ban of 4 months
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law
Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law
the permit to the newspaper "bayrūt" depends on them henceforth publishing nothing which is not in accordance with the bases, communiqués, and instructions of censorship (murāqaba)
Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law

Publication of articles which violated the basic principle of the Press Law. publication gap of ten days, between no 4446 (6 Nov) and 4447 (15 Nov). Henceforth they have to comply with the basic principles [of the press law]
Henceforth they have to comply with the basic principles [of the press law]
Warning to "some" local newspapers which published articles without authorisation which is prohibited by law
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (*uṣūl al-murāqaba*)
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (*uṣūl al-murāqaba*)
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (*uṣūl al-murāqaba*)
Publication of articles prohibited by the censors for unnamed reasons
Violation of the basic principles of censorship (*uṣūl al-murāqaba*)
Publication of uncensored phrases. immediate indefinite ban from today onwards
For an unnamed reason (pardoned by the sultan); Thamarāt ceased publication between 1500 (14 Nov) and 1501 (27 Feb)
Permit for resuming publication after one month of suspension (since 7 Ram 1322)
Thamarāt resumed publication after it received an imperial permit.
BOA DH Mkt 1094/17, 5 Jum I 1324 aH [27 Jun. 1906]
Something on al-Fīḥa printing press and the ʿĀlim Yasīn Ḥilmī Takkī al-Dīn, who applied for a permit to publish a weekly newspaper of the same name
Mistakes resulting from careless editing. Repetition of the offence will cause suspension
BOA DH Mkt 1204/6, 28 Jum II 1325 aH [8 Aug. 1907]

ʿAbd al-Qādir Badrān Efendi obtained the permit from the censor and provincial mektubci to publish the weekly Arabic-speaking newspaper Mawārid al-Ḥikma in Damascus. Probably this refers to the application only
BOA YA Res 151/14, 17 Shaw 1325 aH [23 Nov. 1907]
Permit was given to publish the newspaper Mawārid al-Ḥikma in Damascus
Violation of the basic principle of the Press Law. al-Maḥabba resumed publication after a month
newspapers and concessions- telegram from the ministry of the interior dating 18 tammūz 1324 concerning those who started to publish newspapers without the required permits
BOA DH Mkt 1280/18, 15 Raj 1326 aH [13 Aug. 1908]
ʿAbd al-Qādir Badrān Efendi obtained the permit to publish the weekly newspaper Mawārid al-Ḥikma in Damascus.
BOA DH Mkt 1298/31, 23 Shaʿ 1326 aH [20 Sep. 1908]
Nāṣīf Bey obtained a permit for the Arabic-speaking weekly al-ʿAṣr al-Jadīd in Damascus
BOA DH Mkt 1298/31, 23 Shaʿ 1326 aH [20 Sep. 1908]
Ḥayrī Bey, graduate of the teachers' college, obtained the permit to publish the Turkish-speaking daily newspaper al-takammul / Tekemmül
BOA DH Mkt 2614/97, 28 Shaʿ 1326 aH [25 Sep. 1908]
Muḥammad Ḥayrī Efendi Shabīb zade obtained the permit to publish a newspaper under the title of Dimashq
daily published in Beirut by Iskandar Efendi Khūrī and Khalīl Efendi Zayniyah
Thamarat al-funun: ʿAbd al-Qāḍīr Efendi Qabbānī announced that he will discontinue his newspaper after 35 years
al-rawḍa will be published thrice a week from now on
BOA DH Mkt 2651/22, 14 Shaw 1326 aH [9 Nov. 1908]

Muḥammad Mīdānī Efendi did what was necessary to obtain a permit for publishing an Arabic-speaking newspaper in Damascus under the title of Kashf al-Ḥijāb. He did so in compliance with the law on printing presses, which is enforced by the ministry of gendarmerie
new newspapers: i.a. sada al-shahbāʾ: Tue, Thu and Sat in Aleppo
BOA DH Mkt 2670/17, 2 Dhu I 1326 aH [26 Nov. 1908]
In compliance with the Vali of Syria, Muḥammad [Kurd ʿAlī] Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press and to publish a daily newspaper under the title of al-Muqtabas
BOA DH Mkt 2677/20, 13 Dhu I 1326 aH [7 Dec. 1908]
Muḥammad Shākir, graduate of the Mekteb-i Mülkiye, and Fāris Khūri, graduate of the AUB, obtained the permit to publish a daily newspaper under the title of al-Band in Damascus

received the second number of the newspaper al-muqtabas, a new daily political and social newspaper, published in Damascus by Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī, who also publishes al-muqtabas journal. Price of annual subscription in Damascus = 4 Mecidiye, and £T1 in if delivered to other places inside the Ottoman Empire. Frcs 25 for foreign subscribers [available at AUB!]
Astana: since the declaration of constitutional rights some 380 permits were granted to new newspapers and 38 new printing presses
BOA DH Mkt 2699/23, 9 Dhu II 1326 aH [2 Jan. 1909]
The permit to publish a newspaper under the title of Rawḍat al-Ṣiḥḥa was sent to Ṣāliḥ Efendi, municipal doctor and member of the medical association / physicians club in Damascus
BOA DH Mkt 2772/119, 29 Ṣaf 1327 aH [22 Mar. 1909]
ʿAbdullah Efendi from Damascus obtained the permit to open a printing press (al-Ḥikma) and to publish two newspapers, al-Ḥikma and al-Rafīq, in his hometown
BOA DH Mkt 2820/36, 2 Jum I 1327 aH [22 May 1909]

The owner of the concession for the al-Ṣalāḥ printing press in Damascus, Ḥabīb Birhūm Efendi, obtained the permit for an Ottoman and Arabic speaking newspaper under the title al-Sharq after he had handed in all the required stuff
BOA DH Mkt 2824/13, 7 Jum I 1327 aH [27 May 1909]
ʿAbd al-Qādir Khaṭīb zade from Damascus obtained the permit to publish the weekly newspaper Faṣl a-Ḥitāb and to open the al-Maṭbaʿa al-ʿUmūmiyya printing press
BOA DH Mkt 2877/81, 28 Jum II 1327 aH [17 Jul. 1909]
Adīb Efendi Adab zade obtained the permit to publish an Ottoman and Arabic speaking daily newspaper under the title of "al-Nāqid al-Suwarī", which he had applied for
"Maṭbaʿalar Qānūnu." Promulgated on 11 Raj 1327 aH, 16 Tam 1325 R [29 Jul. 1909]. In Düstur 1 of Tertip II. Dersaadet: Matbaa-yi Osmaniye, 1909: 404-405
maṭbaʿalar qānūnu, Law on Printing Presses
"Maṭbūʿāt Qānūnu." Promulgated on 11 Raj 1327 aH, 16 Tam 1325 R [29 Jul. 1909]. In Düstur 1 of Tertip II. Dersaadet: Matbaa-yi Osmaniye, 1909: 395-403
new newspapers: inter alia in Beirut and Aleppo (al-shaʿb)
new newspapers: inter alia in Beirut and Aleppo (al-shaʿb)
Numerous raids of the offices of Lisān in connection with their opposition to the new press law
Lisān 17 Sep. 1909:2Lisān 8 Oct. 1909:2FO 618/3 Damascus Draft 50, Quarterly Report, Devey to Lowther 4 Oct. 1909FO 618/3 Damascus Draft 1, Quarterly Report, Devey to Lowther 2 Jan. 1910
Trial of the publisher for charges levelled by the municipality
BOA DH Mui 30-1/15, 20 Shaw 1327 aH [4 Nov. 1909]
Aḥmad Kurd [ʿAlī] obtained the permit to publish the daily al-Umma in Damascus

new daily newspaper in Damascus: al-umma, jarīdat siyāsiyya, iqtiṣādiyya, ijtimāʿiyya, adabiyya, published by Aḥmad Efendi Kurd ʿAlī. lisan received the first two numbers. annual subscription fee is £T1
first number of the daily al-sharq from Damascus arrived.
After Muḥammad Kurd ʿAlī was cleared from the alleged treason, all *al-Umma* reverted back to its old name *al-Muqtabas*.
new newsaper “al-muntakhabāt” published in Damascus (politics, arts, news), published on Sat and Tue, owner is the excellent teacher Shaykh Aḥmad al-ʿAṭṭār, editor is our friend Adīb Efendi Naẓmī
new journals and papers in Homs
new journals and papers in Homs. rather detailed report
Muqtabas ceased publication for a week and was republished as *al-Qabas*.
Muqtabas resumed publication under the old name
